6.3 Working with the Project Workspace APIs - Reference Documentation

Authors: Microsoft Corporation

Version: 8.0.0

Table of Contents

6.1/r/project/workspace/list
6.2/r/project/workspace/get
6.3/r/project/workspace/upload
6.4/r/project/workspace/transfer
6.5/r/project/workspace/push
6.6/r/project/workspace/save
6.7/r/project/workspace/store
6.8/r/project/workspace/load
6.9/r/project/workspace/delete

6.3 Working with the Project Workspace APIs

The project workspace APIs facilitate working with objects found in the project workspace.

Workspace Object Retrieval

  1. Retrieve a summary list of objects found in the workspace using the /r/project/workspace/list call.
  2. Retrieve a DeployR-encoded representation of one or more objects found in the workspace using the /r/project/workspace/get call.

Workspace Object Creation

Typically objects are created in the workspace when commands are executed. However, there are a number of APIs that allow the direct creation of objects in the workspace:

  1. Upload an object into the workspace from a file on the users computer using the /r/project/workspace/upload call.
  2. Transfer an object into the workspace from a URL using the /r/project/workspace/transfer call.
  3. Push an object into the workspace from a DeployR-encoded object using the /r/project/workspace/push call.

Workspace Objects and the Repository

  1. Workspace objects can be stored directly to the repository using the /r/project/workspace/store call.
  2. Repository-managed files containing R binary objects can be loaded directly to the workspace using the /r/project/workspace/load call.

6.3.1 /r/project/workspace/list

This call lists the objects in the workspace for the specified project.

HTTP Method

GET

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • root - (optional) specifies the object graph root
  • clazz - (optional) specifies the R class based filter
  • filter - (optional) specifies the R object name based filter
  • restrict - (optional) if true, limits returned objects to object types with supported DeployR-encoding
  • pagesize - (optional) specifies the page size for paging results in response markup
  • pageoffset - (optional) specifies the page offset for paging results in response markup

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/workspace/list",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "project": "PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales.",
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378321615345,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original."
            },
            "workspace": {
                "objects": [
                    {
                        "branch": false,
                        "rclass": "character",
                        "name": "x_character",
                        "type": "primitive",
                        "xdf": null
                    },
                    {
                        "branch": true,
                        "rclass": "data.frame",
                        "name": "x_dataframe",
                        "type": "dataframe",
                        "xdf": null
                    },
                    {
                        "branch": false,
                        "rclass": "matrix",
                        "name": "x_matrix",
                        "type": "matrix",
                        "xdf": null
                    }
                ]
            },
            "httpcookie": "675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <success>true</success>
    <call>/r/project/workspace/list</call>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378321739728</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <workspace>
      <objects>
        <object>
          <type>primitive</type>
          <rclass>character</rclass>
          <branch/>
          <xdf/>
          <name>x_character</name>
        </object>
        <object>
          <type>dataframe</type>
          <rclass>data.frame</rclass>
          <branch>true</branch>
          <xdf/>
          <name>x_dataframe</name>
        </object>
        <object>
          <type>matrix</type>
          <rclass>matrix</rclass>
          <branch/>
          <xdf/>
          <name>x_matrix</name>
        </object>
      </objects>
    </workspace>
    <httpcookie>675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.3.2 /r/project/workspace/get

This call retrieves DeployR-encoded objects from the workspace for the specified project.

HTTP Method

GET

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • name - specifies a comma-separated list of object names
  • root - (optional) specifies the object graph root
  • start - (optional) specifies the offset into object data
  • length - (optional) specifies the segment of object data to retrieve
  • infinity - (optional) specifies a custom value for Infinity appearing in R object data returned on the call, otherwise Infinity is represented by 0x7ff0000000000000L
  • nan - (optional) specifies custom value for NaN appearing in R object data returned on the call, otherwise NaN is represented by null
  • encodeDataFramePrimitiveAsVector - (optional) if true, data.frame primitives are encoded vectors in R object data returned on call

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9
name=autos_data

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/workspace/get",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "project": "PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378321946753,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "workspace": {
                "object": {
                    "name": "x_matrix",
                    "type": "matrix",
                    "rclass": "matrix",
                    "value": [
                        [
                            1,
                            3,
                            12
                        ],
                        [
                            2,
                            11,
                            13
                        ]
                    ]
                }
            },
            "httpcookie": "675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/workspace/get</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378321884721</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <workspace>
      <object>
        <name>x_matrix</name>
        <type>matrix</type>
        <rclass>matrix</rclass>
        <values>
          <value>1.0, 3.0, 12.0</value>
          <value>2.0, 11.0, 13.0</value>
        </values>
      </object>
    </workspace>
    <httpcookie>675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.3.3 /r/project/workspace/upload

This call uploads a binary object from file into the workspace for the specified project.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • name - specifies the name of the object file
  • file - ...file content...

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9
name=data.R
file= ...file content...

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/workspace/upload",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "project": "PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378321946753,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "httpcookie": "675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/workspace/upload</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378321884721</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.3.4 /r/project/workspace/transfer

This call transfers a binary object from a URL into the workspace for the specified project.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • name - specifies the name of the object file found on the URL
  • url - specifies the URL

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9
name=data.R
url=http://host/context/data.R

Response Markup (JSON) 

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/workspace/transfer",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "project": "PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378321946753,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "httpcookie": "675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/workspace/transfer</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378321884721</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.3.5 /r/project/workspace/push

This call pushes a DeployR-encoded object into the workspace for the specified project.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • inputs - (optional) DeployR-encoded object inputs
  • csvinputs - (optional) comma-separated list of primitive name/value inputs

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9
inputs={ "mydata" : { "type" : "vector", "value" : [1,2,3] } }
csvinputs=gender,female,age,45

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/workspace/push",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "project": "PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378321946753,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "httpcookie": "675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/workspace/push</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378321884721</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.3.6 /r/project/workspace/save

This call saves the workspace to a file in the working directory for the specified project.

If the name parameter is specified on the call then only the named object is saved as a binary object file to the working directory. Otherwise the entire contents of the workspace are saved.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • name - (optional) specifies a named object for saving
  • descr - (optional) specifies a description to accompany the saved file
  • version - (optional) if true, the new file will be renamed to avoid overwriting

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9
name=x_matrix
descr=Saved from workspace.

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/workspace/save",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "project": "PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378321946753,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "directory": {
                "file": {
                    "filename": "x_matrix.rData",
                    "descr": "Saved matrix from workspace."
                    "length": 101,
                    "type": "application/octet-stream",
                    "category": "R",
                    "lastmodified": 1378322423000,
                    "url": "http://dhost:dport/deployr/r/project/
                    directory/download/
                    PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9/x_matrix.rData"
                }
            },
            "httpcookie": "675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/workspace/save</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378321884721</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <directory>
      <file>
        <filename>x_matrix.rData</filename>
        <descr>Saved matrix from workspace.</descr>
        <length>101</length>
        <type>application/octet-stream</type>
        <category>R</category>
        <lastmodified>1378322492000</lastmodified>
        <url>http://dhost:dport/deployr/r/project/
        directory/download/
        PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9/x_matrix.rData</url>
      </file>
    </directory>
    <httpcookie>675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.3.7 /r/project/workspace/store

This call stores the workspace as a binary object to the repository.

If the name parameter is specified on the call, then only the named object is stored as a binary object in the repository. Otherwise the entire contents of the workspace are stored.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • name - (optional) specifies a named object for storing
  • descr - (optional) specifies a description to accompany the saved file
  • tags - (optional) specifies tag words to associate with the repository file
  • restricted - (optional) comma-separated list of role names, which makes the file visible to authenticated users with these roles
  • shared - (optional) if true, the file will be shared , which makes the file visible to authenticated users
  • published - (optional) if true, the file will be published , which makes the file visible to authenticated and anonymous users
  • newversion - (optional) if true, the new file will be renamed to avoid overwriting

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9
descr=Store from workspace.

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/workspace/store",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "project": "PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378321946753,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "repository": {
                "file": {
                    "latestby": "george",
                    "url": "http://dhost:dport/deployr/r/
                    repository/file/download/george/x_matrix.rData",
                    "filename": "x_matrix.rData",
                    "author": "george",
                    "authors": [
                        "george"
                    ],
                    "version": null,
                    "descr": "Stored matrix from workspace."
                    "tags": null,
                    "length": 101,
                    "md5": "8a42ec2b108587b526f9c69d2e183a06",
                    "category": "R",
                    "restricted": null,
                    "shared": false,
                    "published": false,
                    "access": "Private",
                    "type": "application/octet-stream",
                    "lastModified": 1378322785349
                }
            },
            "httpcookie": "675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/workspace/store</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378321884721</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <repository>
      <file>
        <filename>x_matrix.rData</filename>
        <descr>Stored matrix from workspace.</descr>
        <author>george</author>
        <version/>
        <tags/>
        <authors>
          <author>george</author>
        </authors>
        <latestby>george</latestby>
        <length>101</length>
        <type>application/octet-stream</type>
        <md5>8a42ec2b108587b526f9c69d2e183a06</md5>
        <category>R</category>
        <restricted/>
        <shared/>
        <published/>
        <access>Private</access>
        <lastModified>1378322649779</lastModified>
        <url>http://dhost:dport/deployr/r/repository/
        file/download/george/x_matrix.rData</url>
      </file>
    </repository>
    <httpcookie>675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.3.8 /r/project/workspace/load

This call loads a binary object from a file in the repository into the workspace for the specified project.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • filename - specifies the repository file name
  • author - specifies the repository file author
  • version - (optional) specifies the repository file version

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9
filename=mydata.rData
author=testuser

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/workspace/load",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "project": "PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378321946753,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "httpcookie": "675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/workspace/load</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378321884721</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.3.9 /r/project/workspace/delete

This call deletes an object from the workspace for the specified project.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • name - specifies the object name

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9
name=mydata

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/workspace/delete",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "project": "PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378321946753,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "httpcookie": "675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/workspace/delete</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-4f9fe8bf-9425-4f2c-aa15-5d94818988f9</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378321884721</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>
